benchmark_details.name: AUTOHALLUSION
benchmark_details.overview: The first automated benchmark generation approach that employs several key strategies to create a diverse range of hallucination examples in vision-language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create hallucination benchmarks automatically and evaluate LVLMs against these benchmarks.
audience: Researchers in AI and machine learning
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The inability to explore attributes of objects aside from existence and spatial relations.

methodology.calculation: Success rates are calculated based on correctness and consistency of model responses.
methodology.interpretation: Interested in probing hallucination rates based on various attack strategies.
methodology.baseline_results: Success rates of LVLMs on benchmarks created by AUTOHALLUSION
methodology.validation: Validated through comparison with ground-truth answers.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: No personal data was used during the benchmark creation.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Generated images from DALL-E and COCO dataset are under respective licenses.
